column4: Is there any way to access the run-program-dialog (Alt+F2) from the menus?
I believe you can add it
right click on Applications then edit menus
thanks, but I didn't see it anywhere in there... I don't even know if the Alt+F2 dialog is an external application or if it is part of an already running app...
yah I just looked, I thought it used to be there in hardy...you running ibex?
yes, ibex. ardchoille: thanks, so I guess there isn't a menu...
ahh...it's an applet....right click on the top panel and add to panel, it's in there
here is the command like to add it to your menu " gnome-panel-control --run-dialog "
thanks a lot. I'm writing a manual and I was looking for the menu equivelant to instruct the new users, but that's useful too.
er...I just tested it and it didn't work...sigh
ardchoille: and I think there isn't a gksu menu equivelant, right?
from what I've read, it's part of the panel itself
I'm trying to find what the panel applet calls..
yah I ran the applet and looked at the processes, but I didn't seen anything specific to that applet
maybe this applet itself is embedded...
thanks a lot... I think this is enough digging for today! :P :D
